descriptions: Does not demonstrate understanding of basic nutritional needs or the role of food in health.
Shows minimal understanding of nutritional needs; struggles to connect food choices with health outcomes.
Demonstrates basic understanding of some nutritional needs; can identify a few healthy food choices.
Demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of nutritional needs and connects food choices to health, but lacks depth.
Shows a strong understanding of nutritional needs and explains how different foods contribute to health and well-being.
Exhibits a comprehensive understanding of nutritional needs, articulates the impact of food choices on overall health, and considers individual dietary requirements.
Unable to apply any decision-making process to select healthy foods.
Attempts to use a decision-making process but struggles to apply it effectively to food choices.
Applies a simple decision-making process to select healthy foods, but the reasoning is limited.
Applies a decision-making process to select healthy foods, considering some factors such as calories and nutrients.
Applies a comprehensive decision-making process to select healthy foods, considering factors such as nutritional value, personal preferences, and availability.
Applies a sophisticated decision-making process to select healthy foods, demonstrating critical evaluation of food labels, marketing, and personal needs; justifies choices with evidence.
Unable to evaluate food options based on health criteria.
Struggles to evaluate food options and identify healthy choices.
Identifies some healthy food options but lacks detailed reasoning.
Evaluates food options and identifies healthy choices with adequate reasoning.
Evaluates food options effectively, providing clear and detailed reasoning for healthy choices.
Critically evaluates a variety of food options, providing nuanced and evidence-based justifications for healthy choices, while also considering potential drawbacks of certain foods.
